tasks.title: Initialize Swift Package Structure
tasks.description: Create the Swift package with all required targets and configure dependencies including swift-subprocess
tasks.details:
1. Create Package.swift with Swift 6.0 tools version
2. Define targets: HarvestBinCommandsCore, HarvestBinCommandsDefaults, HarvestBinCommands, HarvestBinCommandsDemo
3. Add swift-subprocess dependency from GitHub
4. Configure platform requirements (macOS 12.0+)
5. Set up test targets for each module
6. Create directory structure for all targets

Package.swift structure:
```swift
// swift-tools-version: 6.0
import PackageDescription

let package = Package(
    name: "HarvestBinCommands",
    platforms: [.macOS(.v12)],
    products: [
        .library(name: "HarvestBinCommandsCore", targets: ["HarvestBinCommandsCore"]),
        .library(name: "HarvestBinCommandsDefaults", targets: ["HarvestBinCommandsDefaults"]),
        .library(name: "HarvestBinCommands", targets: ["HarvestBinCommands"]),
        .executable(name: "HarvestBinCommandsDemo", targets: ["HarvestBinCommandsDemo"])
    ],
    dependencies: [
        .package(url: "https://github.com/apple/swift-subprocess.git", from: "1.0.0")
    ],
    targets: [
        .target(name: "HarvestBinCommandsCore", dependencies: [.product(name: "Subprocess", package: "swift-subprocess")]),
        .target(name: "HarvestBinCommandsDefaults", dependencies: ["HarvestBinCommandsCore"]),
        .target(name: "HarvestBinCommands", dependencies: ["HarvestBinCommandsDefaults"]),
        .executableTarget(name: "HarvestBinCommandsDemo", dependencies: ["HarvestBinCommands"]),
        .testTarget(name: "HarvestBinCommandsCoreTests", dependencies: ["HarvestBinCommandsCore"]),
        .testTarget(name: "HarvestBinCommandsDefaultsTests", dependencies: ["HarvestBinCommandsDefaults"]),
        .testTarget(name: "HarvestBinCommandsTests", dependencies: ["HarvestBinCommands"])
    ]
)
```

tasks.title: Implement Core Command Infrastructure
tasks.description: Build the foundation layer in HarvestBinCommandsCore with base protocols, command executor using swift-subprocess, and error handling
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Mock subprocess execution for unit testing
2. Test command validation logic
3. Verify error handling for different failure scenarios
4. Test output parsing with various formats
5. Verify async execution doesn't block
6. Test sudo command handling
7. Mock process killing functionality

subtasks.title: Define CommandProtocol and related types
subtasks.description: Create the base protocol for all commands with validation requirements and associated error types
subtasks.details: Define CommandProtocol with command, arguments, requiresSudo, affectedProcess properties and validate() method. Create CommandError enum with cases for validationFailed, executionFailed, permissionDenied, timeout, and invalidOutput. Include Sendable conformance for actor compatibility.

subtasks.title: Implement CommandResult structure
subtasks.description: Create the result type that encapsulates command execution output, errors, and exit codes
subtasks.details: Create CommandResult struct with exitCode: Int32, standardOutput: String, standardError: String, executionTime: TimeInterval. Add convenience computed properties like isSuccess, hasOutput, combinedOutput. Make it Sendable for async contexts.

subtasks.title: Build CommandExecutor actor core
subtasks.description: Implement the actor-based command executor with basic subprocess execution using swift-subprocess
subtasks.details: Create CommandExecutor as a public actor with shared singleton. Implement basic execute() method using Subprocess library. Handle environment setup, working directory, and basic async execution flow. Include execution timeout handling with default 30 seconds.

subtasks.title: Implement sudo privilege escalation
subtasks.description: Add secure sudo command execution with proper privilege handling and security considerations
subtasks.details: Extend CommandExecutor to detect requiresSudo commands and prepend sudo to execution. Implement sudo password caching detection and prompt handling. Add security validations to prevent command injection. Handle sudo timeout and authentication failures gracefully.

subtasks.title: Create output parsing utilities
subtasks.description: Build utilities for parsing and processing command output in various formats
subtasks.details: Create OutputParser with methods for parsing JSON output, plist format, key-value pairs, and line-based output. Add trim/clean utilities for standardOutput and standardError. Include encoding detection and UTF-8 handling. Support streaming output for long-running commands.

subtasks.title: Implement process killing functionality
subtasks.description: Add capability to kill affected processes after command execution when specified
subtasks.details: Extend CommandExecutor with killProcess() method using killall command. Implement safe process name validation. Add delay before killing to allow settings to save. Handle cases where process doesn't exist. Support both SIGTERM and SIGKILL signals.

subtasks.title: Build comprehensive error handling system
subtasks.description: Create robust error handling with detailed error messages and recovery suggestions
subtasks.details: Implement error mapping from subprocess exit codes to CommandError cases. Add detailed error descriptions with recovery suggestions. Handle network errors, permission issues, missing commands, and malformed output. Include error context preservation and logging capabilities.

subtasks.title: Create unit tests with mocking framework
subtasks.description: Develop comprehensive unit tests using XCTest with subprocess mocking for all core components
subtasks.details: Create MockSubprocess for testing command execution without system calls. Test all CommandProtocol validation scenarios. Verify CommandExecutor async behavior and timeout handling. Test sudo command construction and security. Mock process killing with various scenarios. Test error handling edge cases.

subtasks.title: Add Type Conversion Error Handling

subtasks.details: Create DefaultsConversionError enum with cases for invalid format, type mismatch, parsing failure, etc. Ensure all from(defaultsOutput:) implementations throw descriptive errors. Handle edge cases like empty strings, null values, and malformed data.

subtasks.title: Write Comprehensive Unit Tests

subtasks.details: Implement setShowDesktopIcons(_ show: Bool) method. Note the inverted logic: use !show for 'CreateDesktop' key in 'com.apple.finder' domain. tasks.title: Complete Testing, Documentation, and Polish
tasks.description: Write comprehensive tests for all modules, create documentation, add examples, and optimize performance
tasks.details:
Finalize the package with testing and documentation:

1. Unit Tests:
- Test coverage >80% for all modules
- Mock subprocess for command execution tests
- Test all value type conversions
- Verify error handling paths
- Test validation logic

2. Integration Tests:
- Test command execution flow
- Verify process restart behavior
- Test sudo command handling
- End-to-end scenarios

3. Documentation:
- README.md with installation and usage
- API documentation using DocC
- Usage examples for each command category
- Migration guide from direct defaults usage
- Security considerations document

4. Examples:
```swift
// Example: Configure Dock
let dock = Defaults.Dock()
try await dock.setIconSize(48)
try await dock.setPosition(.bottom)
try await dock.setAutoHide(true)

// Example: Configure Screenshots
let screenshots = Defaults.Screenshot()
try await screenshots.setLocation("~/Desktop/Screenshots")
try await screenshots.setFormat(.png)
try await screenshots.setDisableShadow(true)
```

5. Performance optimization:
- Batch command execution where possible
- Efficient subprocess usage
- Minimize process restarts

6. Polish:
- Consistent error messages
- Proper Swift 6 concurrency
- Memory usage optimization
- SwiftLint configuration

7. Release preparation:
- Version 1.0.0 tag
- CHANGELOG.md
- Contributing guidelines
- GitHub Actions CI/CD
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Run full test suite with coverage report
2. Manual testing of demo app on multiple macOS versions
3. Performance profiling with Instruments
4. Documentation review and validation
5. Security audit of sudo commands
6. Integration testing with real defaults
7. Beta testing feedback incorporation

subtasks.title: Create Unit Test Suite with 80%+ Coverage
subtasks.description: Develop comprehensive unit tests covering all modules, mocking subprocess execution, testing value conversions, error handling, and validation logic
subtasks.details: Set up XCTest framework and create test targets. Write unit tests for DefaultsWriter, DefaultsReader, CommandBuilder, and all command modules. Mock Process execution to test command construction without system interaction. Test all value type conversions (Bool, Int, Float, String, Data). Verify error handling paths including validation failures and subprocess errors. Generate coverage reports and ensure >80% coverage across all modules.

subtasks.title: Implement Integration Tests
subtasks.description: Create integration tests for command execution flow, process restart behavior, sudo handling, and end-to-end scenarios
subtasks.details: Write integration tests that verify complete command execution flow from API call to subprocess execution. Test process restart behavior for Dock and Finder. Create tests for sudo command handling including permission scenarios. Develop end-to-end test scenarios covering common use cases. Set up test fixtures and mock environments for reproducible testing.

subtasks.title: Generate API Documentation with DocC
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive API documentation using DocC including type documentation, usage examples, and integration guides
subtasks.details: Set up DocC configuration for the package. Document all public APIs with detailed descriptions, parameters, return values, and error conditions. Add code examples for each command category. Create conceptual documentation explaining the architecture and design patterns. Generate DocC archive and ensure proper rendering of all documentation.

subtasks.title: Write README with Examples
subtasks.description: Create detailed README with installation instructions, usage examples, API reference, and contribution guidelines
subtasks.details: Write comprehensive README.md including package overview, installation via SPM, basic usage examples for each command category, API quick reference, troubleshooting guide, and contribution guidelines. Add code snippets demonstrating common use cases. Include badges for test coverage, Swift version, and platform support. Create a changelog documenting version history.

subtasks.title: Perform Security Audit for Sudo Commands
subtasks.description: Conduct thorough security review of administrative commands, validate sudo handling, and implement safety measures
subtasks.details: Review all administrative commands for security vulnerabilities. Validate sudo command construction to prevent injection attacks. Implement input sanitization for all user-provided strings. Add safeguards for dangerous operations like auto-login. Create security documentation outlining best practices. Test permission handling and error scenarios. Implement command validation to reject potentially harmful inputs.

subtasks.title: Optimize Performance
subtasks.description: Profile package performance, optimize command execution, reduce memory usage, and improve async operation efficiency
subtasks.details: Use Instruments to profile memory usage and execution time. Optimize command builder for minimal allocations. Implement caching for frequently used commands. Optimize async/await usage patterns. Reduce string allocations in command construction. Profile and optimize regex patterns used in validation. Create performance benchmarks and document optimization results.

subtasks.title: Integrate SwiftLint
subtasks.description: Set up SwiftLint with custom rules, fix all linting issues, and configure for CI integration
subtasks.details: Install and configure SwiftLint with appropriate rules for the project. Create .swiftlint.yml with custom configuration. Fix all linting warnings and errors across the codebase. Set up pre-commit hooks for automatic linting. Configure SwiftLint to run in CI pipeline. Document coding standards and style guide. Ensure consistent code formatting throughout the package.

subtasks.title: Prepare Release with CI/CD
subtasks.description: Set up continuous integration, create release automation, configure GitHub Actions, and prepare for package distribution
subtasks.details: Create GitHub Actions workflows for testing, linting, and documentation generation. Set up matrix testing for multiple Swift/macOS versions. Configure automatic release creation with semantic versioning. Create release notes template and automation. Set up code signing if required. Configure package publication to Swift Package Index. Create demo app for showcase. Prepare marketing materials and announcement strategy.
